prompt: <description>- **Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom (Part 1)** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with Euler angles of [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. For the 2D sketch, draw a rectangle on face_1 of the coordinate system with the following lines: Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] Line 2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.667] Line 3: [0.75, 0.667] to [0.0, 0.667] Line 4: [0.0, 0.667] to [0.0, 0.0] The sketch should have one face (face_1) and one loop (loop_1) with four lines. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the sketch to a depth of 0.2671 in the direction of the normal vector. The height, width, and length of the final shape are approximately 0.75, 0.75, and 0.75, respectively. - **Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and a flat bottom (Part 2)** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with Euler angles of [90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.4955, 0.2987]. For the 2D sketch, draw a circle on face_1 of the coordinate system with the center at [0.1753, 0.1753] and a radius of 0.1753. The sketch should have one face (face_1) and one loop (loop_1) with one circle. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.3505. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Cut the sketch to a depth of 0.2671 in the opposite direction of the normal vector to create the cylindrical object. The length, width, and height of the final shape are approximately 0.3505, 0.3505, and 0.2671, respectively. Note: The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole through its center. The hole is slightly larger than the prism's width.</description>
